title: Name Not on the Ocean Week Plaque, yet others with "sex" in their names are?

embed.description: What is the Nautilus-themed Artificial Reef? The Nautilus artificial reef was the final reward in Ocean Week 2015. Players from all around Oceania played games with specific Ocean Week champions (like Fizz, Nami or Nautilus) to contribute one point per win. The points required to construct the artificial reef was a hefty 275,000 from all Oceanic players.

body:
Ctrl + F and search sex, 67 names are found, yet mine isn't on there, I understand you don't want offensive names but not everyone had/have enough money to afford a name change just to get their name onto a plaque or enough hours of their life to grind their way through games for one. Can I ask for a compromise to have my name on the plaque as just TechnoCat or TechnoCast (since this is the name that was intended if it wasn't for it being a character limit) if it isn't too much to ask. 
Just going to attach this screenshot also, which shows names like "sexualoffender" being accepted yet SexbangTechnoCat not in sight. http://puu.sh/mu3dj/f2d0efed7d.png

replies.body: My name isn't on there either, and I made a big deal about earning enough points so I definitely know I did...
Just did a check for myself. Not on there as well
My name wasn't on it either and I don't even have an offensive name.

Are you positive you fulfilled the requirements to get your name on it?

> For a player to get their Summoner name on the artificial reef, you needed to earn 3 points during the Challenge Phase of Ocean Week 2015, which lasted from January 23 through to January 26, 2015 at 2:00 AM AEDT.

If so, you'll want to submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to get help for this. Provide the information you have here to them. If they deemed your name "more offensive" than those others, then there's nothing you can do unfortunately.

> **Can I change my Summoner name on the artificial reef?**
>
No. All Summoner names are recorded as they were the end of the Ocean Week Challenge phase (January 26 at 2:00 AM AEDT back in 2015) and are final.
